articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: But the strong winds that fanned the flames were expected to pick up again today, worsening conditions.
articles.title: Los Angeles firefighters see progress in containing blazes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol will not attend the first hearing of the trial to determine if he his removed from office or reinstated, Yonhap news agency quoted his lawyer as saying on Sunday.
articles.title: South Korea Yoon's lawyer says president will not attend first impeachment trial hearing, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Croats were voting on Sunday in a presidential run-off election, with incumbent Zoran Milanovic ahead in opinion surveys of Dragan Primorac of the ruling Croatia's Democratic Union for the chiefly ceremonial position.
articles.title: Croats vote for president, with incumbent Milanovic ahead in opinion polls

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japanese Foreign Minister Takeshi Iwaya said on Sunday he planned to attend Donald Trump's inauguration as U.S. president on Jan. 20, as Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's government hopes to maintain close ties with its security ally.
articles.title: Japan Foreign Minister Iwaya says he will attend Trump inauguration ceremony

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A red dragon, a feline deity and dogs and cats cover Tanyapong Jaikham's rice paddies in northern Thailand, a living tribute in rice plants to flooding that inundated nearby areas in September, stranding thousands.
articles.title: Thai rice fields transformed into vibrant art depicting red dragon, feline deity

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chad's ruling party won two-thirds of the seats in the legislative election which was boycotted by many in the opposition last month, provisional results showed on Sunday, reinforcing President Mahamat Idriss Deby's hold on power.
articles.title: Chad ruling party wins parliamentary majority, provisional results show

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Authorities in Moldova's separatist Transdniestria region said on Saturday that energy conservation measures have allowed them to ease restrictions caused by a halt to Russian gas supplies, with the duration of rolling blackouts to be further reduced.
articles.title: Moldova's separatist Transdniestria region reduces blackouts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Malaysia Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said the government did not conceal any document relating to jailed former premier Najib Razak's home detention, state media reported.
articles.title: Malaysia PM denies hiding document on ex-premier Najib's home detention

articles.author: Pesha Magid
articles.description: Foreign ministers and top diplomats from Western and Middle Eastern countries are meeting Syria's new foreign minister in the Saudi capital Riyadh on Sunday at the first such regional meeting on Syria since President Bashar al-Assad was ousted last month.
articles.title: Syria talks being held in Riyadh with Western and regional participation

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden spoke with Pope Francis on Saturday and awarded him the Presidential Medal of Freedom with Distinction, the nation's highest civilian honor, the White House said.
articles.title: Biden awards Pope Francis medal of freedom, highest US civilian honor
